creator: Strontium
title: Displaying numbers using a homemade arduino mini shield!
materials_required: Numeric display (7 segment display, common cathode)
description: This project demonstrates how to control numeric displays using an Arduino mini shield. The shield utilizes a 4511 decoder IC to translate binary coded decimal inputs into decimal numbers for display on a 7-segment display.
steps: Gather the required components: resistors, numeric display, IC socket, male headers, wires and a PCB board.
Solder the 4511 decoder IC, resistors, and wires onto the perfboard according to the schematic.
Solder the male headers to the perfboard, ensuring they are aligned and do not touch each other.
Connect the pull-down resistors to ground and pin 5 of the IC.
Connect pin 16 to V+ and pin 8 to V-.
Connect the headers to the Arduino in the following order: GND, V+, BCD input A (pin 12), BCD input B (pin 11), BCD input C (pin 10), and BCD input D (pin 9).
Insert the 4511 IC into the IC socket, ensuring it is oriented correctly.
Pry the header row to its end point so you get more space for soldering.
